verses.verse: Then they are glad because they are quiet; So He guides them to their desired haven.
(Ps. 107:8, 15, 21) Oh, that men would give thanks to the LORD for His goodness, And for His wonderful works to the children of men!
Let them exalt Him also (Ps. 22:22, 25) in the assembly of the people, And praise Him in the company of the elders.
He (1 Kin. 17:1, 7; Is. 50:2) turns rivers into a wilderness, And the watersprings into dry ground;
A (Gen. 13:10; Deut. 29:23) fruitful land into barrenness, For the wickedness of those who dwell in it.
(Ps. 114:8; (Is. 41:17, 18)) He turns a wilderness into pools of water, And dry land into watersprings.
There He makes the hungry dwell, That they may establish a city for a dwelling place,
And sow fields and plant vineyards, That they may yield a fruitful harvest.
(Gen. 12:2; 17:16, 20) He also blesses them, and they multiply greatly; And He does not let their cattle (Ex. 1:7; (Deut. 7:14)) decrease.
When they are (2 Kin. 10:32) diminished and brought low Through oppression, affliction, and sorrow,
(Job 12:21, 24) He pours contempt on princes, And causes them to wander in the wilderness where there is no way;
(1 Sam. 2:8; (Ps. 113:7, 8)) Yet He sets the poor on high, far from affliction, And (Ps. 78:52) makes their families like a flock.
(Job 5:15, 16) The righteous see it and rejoice, And all (Job 5:16; Ps. 63:11; (Rom. 3:19)) iniquity stops its mouth.
